channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Massive 149 Million Credential Leak Exposes Gmail, Facebook, and Financial Service Users
item.description:
Headline: Massive 149 Million Credential Leak Exposes Gmail, Facebook, and Financial Service Users

Summary:
A publicly accessible, unencrypted 96 GB database containing 149.4 million unique login credentials has been discovered by a security researcher. The data, believed to be compiled from various infostealer malware logs and past breaches, impacts an estimated 48 million Gmail accounts, alongside users of Facebook, financial services, government portals, and numerous other online platforms. The leak includes usernames, passwords, and the direct login URLs, posing a significant risk of account takeover and fraud for millions of individuals globally.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A massive 96 GB database containing 149 million unique credentials for services like Gmail, Facebook, and financial institutions has been discovered exposed online. Learn about the impact and how to protect yourself.

Article Slug: massive-149m-credential-leak-exposes-gmail-facebook-financial-services

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Windows 11 Fails to Boot for Some Users After Installing January 2026 Security Updates
item.description:
Headline: Windows 11 Fails to Boot for Some Users After Installing January 2026 Security Updates

Summary:
Microsoft is investigating widespread reports of Windows 11 devices failing to boot after installing the January 2026 security updates, including cumulative update KB5074109. Affected users are met with a black screen and an 'UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME' stop error. The issue primarily impacts physical devices running Windows 11 versions 25H2 and 24H2. Microsoft has acknowledged the reports and is gathering information via the Feedback Hub to determine the root cause and develop a fix.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Patch Management, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft confirms it is investigating a bug in the January 2026 Windows 11 security updates (KB5074109) that causes boot failures and an 'UNMOUNTABLE_BOOT_VOLUME' error.

Article Slug: microsoft-investigates-windows-11-boot-failures-after-january-2026-updates

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Nike Probes Data Breach Claim by 'WorldLeaks' Extortion Group
item.description:
Headline: Nike Probes Data Breach Claim by 'WorldLeaks' Extortion Group

Summary:
Global apparel giant Nike has launched an investigation into a potential data breach after being listed as a victim by the 'WorldLeaks' data extortion group. The group, which emerged in 2025 and focuses on data theft without deploying ransomware, threatened to publish stolen Nike data on January 24. Nike has confirmed it is assessing the situation. The type and volume of the allegedly stolen data have not been disclosed by the attackers.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Nike has launched an investigation after the 'WorldLeaks' data extortion group claimed to have stolen corporate data and threatened to leak it. Learn about the threat actor and the potential impact.

Article Slug: nike-investigates-data-breach-claim-from-worldleaks-extortion-group

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Sandworm Deploys New 'DynoWiper' Malware in Failed Attack on Polish Power Grid
item.description:
Headline: Sandworm Deploys New 'DynoWiper' Malware in Failed Attack on Polish Power Grid

Summary:
The Russian state-sponsored hacking group Sandworm has been attributed with a major, albeit unsuccessful, cyberattack against Poland's power system in late December 2025. Poland's energy minister described it as the 'largest cyber attack' on their energy infrastructure in years. Cybersecurity firm ESET linked the attack to Sandworm and discovered the use of a previously undocumented destructive malware, which has been named 'DynoWiper'. This incident underscores Sandworm's continued focus on targeting critical infrastructure with new cyber weapons.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Russian state-sponsored group Sandworm is linked to a major cyberattack on Poland's energy infrastructure using a new destructive malware called 'DynoWiper'. Learn about the threat actor and the implications for critical infrastructure security.

Article Slug: sandworm-deploys-new-dynowiper-malware-in-attack-on-polish-power-grid

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Phishing Campaign Hits Russia with Amnesia RAT, Uses GitHub and Dropbox for Payload Delivery
item.description:
Headline: Phishing Campaign Hits Russia with Amnesia RAT, Uses GitHub and Dropbox for Payload Delivery

Summary:
A sophisticated, multi-stage phishing campaign is targeting users in Russia, delivering a combination of the Amnesia remote access trojan (RAT) and ransomware. The attack, analyzed by Fortinet FortiGuard Labs, is notable for its use of public cloud services like GitHub and Dropbox to host payloads and its use of a tool called 'defendnot' to disable Microsoft Defender antivirus. The campaign relies on social engineering and abuse of native Windows features rather than software exploits to achieve system compromise.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Ransomware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A sophisticated phishing campaign targets Russian users with Amnesia RAT and ransomware, using GitHub and Dropbox for payload delivery and a tool to disable Microsoft Defender. Learn how the attack works and how to defend against it.

Article Slug: multi-stage-phishing-campaign-targets-russia-with-amnesia-rat-and-ransomware

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks
item.description:
Headline: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks

Summary:
The notorious cyber extortion syndicate ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for breaching business intelligence firm Crunchbase and financial advisory company Betterment. According to the threat actor, the initial access was gained by using sophisticated voice phishing (vishing) attacks to socially engineer employees and compromise their Okta single sign-on (SSO) credentials. This method allows attackers to bypass weaker forms of multi-factor authentication. Neither of the targeted companies has publicly confirmed the breach.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The ShinyHunters extortion group has claimed responsibility for breaching Crunchbase and Betterment by using voice phishing (vishing) to defeat Okta single sign-on (SSO) security.

Article Slug: shinyhunters-claims-breaches-of-crunchbase-betterment-via-okta-vishing

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Everest Ransomware Group Leaks 343GB of Under Armour Customer Data
item.description:
Headline: Everest Ransomware Group Leaks 343GB of Under Armour Customer Data

Summary:
The Russia-linked Everest ransomware group has leaked 343 GB of data allegedly stolen from global sportswear brand Under Armour. The massive data dump, which occurred on January 24, 2026, followed a failed extortion attempt. The leaked data is reported to contain the personally identifiable information (PII) of millions of customers, highlighting the 'double extortion' tactic where data publication is the primary threat. Under Armour has not yet commented on the incident.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Everest ransomware group has leaked 343 GB of data, including customer PII, allegedly stolen from Under Armour after a failed extortion attempt. Learn about the impact of this double extortion attack.

Article Slug: everest-ransomware-group-leaks-343gb-of-under-armour-customer-data

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Critical 11-Year-Old Telnet Flaw (CVE-2026-24061) with 9.8 CVSS Score Disclosed
item.description:
Headline: Critical 11-Year-Old Telnet Flaw (CVE-2026-24061) with 9.8 CVSS Score Disclosed

Summary:
A critical, 11-year-old authentication bypass vulnerability in the GNU InetUtils telnet daemon (telnetd) has been disclosed. Tracked as CVE-2026-24061, the flaw carries a CVSS score of 9.8 out of 10.0 and allows a remote attacker to gain root access on affected systems without authentication. The vulnerability impacts GNU InetUtils versions 1.9.3 through 2.7, posing a severe risk to legacy enterprise systems and embedded devices where the outdated Telnet protocol may still be in use.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A critical authentication bypass vulnerability (CVE-2026-24061) with a 9.8 CVSS score has been found in the GNU InetUtils telnet daemon after 11 years. Learn about the risks and how to mitigate.

Article Slug: critical-11-year-old-telnet-vulnerability-cve-2026-24061-disclosed

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Rushes Out Emergency Fix for Outlook Freezing Bug
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Rushes Out Emergency Fix for Outlook Freezing Bug

Summary:
Microsoft has released an emergency out-of-band (OOB) update to fix a bug causing the Microsoft Outlook client to freeze. The issue, which is separate from the recent Windows 11 boot failures, primarily affects users who store their PST (Personal Storage Table) files on cloud services like OneDrive or Dropbox. The problem was reported to be more prevalent in enterprise environments. Users experiencing the freezing issue are advised to apply the emergency patch immediately.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Patch Management, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft releases an emergency out-of-band update to fix a bug causing Outlook to freeze, primarily impacting users who store PST files in cloud services like OneDrive or Dropbox.

Article Slug: microsoft-releases-emergency-update-to-fix-outlook-freezing-issue

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Warning: Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls Are Being Compromised via New SSO Bypass
item.description:
Headline: Warning: Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls Are Being Compromised via New SSO Bypass

Summary:
Security analysts are warning of a new wave of attacks compromising even fully patched Fortinet FortiGate firewalls. The activity, observed since January 15, 2026, allows attackers to bypass SAML-based single sign-on (SSO) authentication to gain administrative access. The attacks result in unauthorized configuration changes, creation of persistent user accounts, and exfiltration of device configurations. Fortinet has reportedly identified a new, distinct attack path related to previously disclosed vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-59718, CVE-2025-59719), suggesting existing patches may not be fully effective.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Security alert: A new attack is compromising even fully patched Fortinet FortiGate firewalls by exploiting a new SAML SSO authentication bypass, granting attackers administrative access.

Article Slug: fully-patched-fortigate-firewalls-compromised-via-sso-bypass

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Warns of Sophisticated Phishing Attacks on Energy Sector
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Warns of Sophisticated Phishing Attacks on Energy Sector

Summary:
The Microsoft Defender Security Research Team has issued a warning about a sophisticated, multi-stage phishing campaign targeting organizations in the energy sector. The attack begins with phishing emails sent from trusted, previously compromised accounts and abuses Microsoft SharePoint for payload delivery. After initial compromise, attackers use Adversary-in-the-Middle (AitM) techniques and create inbox rules for persistence. The campaign then evolves into Business Email Compromise (BEC) activity to expand its reach.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft is warning of a multi-stage phishing and BEC campaign targeting the energy sector that abuses SharePoint and uses Adversary-in-the-Middle (AitM) techniques to bypass MFA.

Article Slug: microsoft-warns-of-aitm-phishing-and-bec-attacks-targeting-energy-firms

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Trend Micro Details New RCE Flaw in MetaGPT (CVE-2026-0761)
item.description:
Headline: Trend Micro Details New RCE Flaw in MetaGPT (CVE-2026-0761)

Summary:
Trend Micro has published details and a detection rule for a new high-severity remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Foundation Agents MetaGPT, tracked as CVE-2026-0761. The exploit, which occurs over HTTP, can be leveraged by an attacker for initial access into a network or for lateral movement. Trend Micro has released DDI RULE 5627 to detect exploitation attempts and advises organizations to update security products and scan for signs of compromise.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Trend Micro has released details on CVE-2026-0761, a high-severity remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Foundation Agents MetaGPT that is exploitable over HTTP.

Article Slug: trend-micro-details-new-rce-exploit-for-metagpt-cve-2026-0761

Published Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Microsoft Issues Emergency Out-of-Band Patches for Flawed January Updates
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Issues Emergency Out-of-Band Patches for Flawed January Updates

Summary:
Microsoft has released several emergency out-of-band (OOB) updates on January 24, 2026, to address significant bugs introduced by its January 13 Patch Tuesday release. The faulty updates caused a range of issues, including Remote Desktop connection failures, application hangs when accessing cloud storage like OneDrive, and system restart failures. The new cumulative updates, including KB5078136 and KB5078238, are available for various Windows versions and are intended to restore stability and functionality for affected users.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Patch Management, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft has issued emergency out-of-band (OOB) updates to fix bugs from its January 2026 patches that caused Remote Desktop failures and application hangs.

Article Slug: microsoft-releases-emergency-oob-updates-to-fix-january-patch-tuesday-issues

Published Date: Sat, 24 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sat, 24 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Sun, 25 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 2

Update History: 2 updates recorded
